parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.40

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Arrays

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Appends array2 to the back of array1 modifying array1. <br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> '''append''' does not return array, it modifies existing array. If you need to return a copy, use "+": 
<code>array3 <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> array1 + array2;</code></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> array1 '''append''' array2

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array1: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> array2: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_arr = [1,2,3];
_arr [[append]] [4,5,6];
[[hint]] [[str]] _arr; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[1,2,3,4,5,6]</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[set]] [[pushBack]] [[pushBackUnique]] [[apply]] [[select]] [[resize]] [[reverse]] [[count]] [[deleteAt]] [[deleteRange]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 9, 2015 - 00:41 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Heeeere's Johnny!|Heeeere's Johnny!]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
<code>_array1 [[append]] _array2</code> is roughly 1.2x faster (depending on array size) than <code>_array1 <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> _array1 + _array2</code>(Averaged over 10.000 iterations with two identical arrays containing the numbers 0 through 9)<br>

The larger the arrays to append, the faster [[append]] is as it does not create a new array, which happens with array addition.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 21, 2015 - 10:27 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Array "unshift" implementation using [[append]], a faster alternative to [[BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift]]:
<code>KK_fnc_unshift <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> {
	[[private]] ["_arr", "_tmp"];
	_arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> _this [[select]] 0;
	_tmp <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [_this [[select]] 1];
	_tmp [[append]] _arr;
	_arr [[resize]] 0;
	_arr [[append]] _tmp;
	_arr
};

// Example
arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [1,2,3];
[arr, 0] [[call]] KK_fnc_unshift; //both arr and return of function are [0,1,2,3]
</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 21, 2015 - 15:21 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Array "insert" implementation using [[append]], much faster alternative to [[BIS_fnc_arrayInsert]]:
<code>KK_fnc_insert <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> {
	[[private]] ["_arr", "_i", "_res"];
	_arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> _this [[select]] 0;
	_i <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> _this [[select]] 2;
	_res <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [];
	_res [[append]] (_arr [[select]] [0, _i]);
	_res [[append]] (_this [[select]] 1);
	_res [[append]] (_arr [[select]] [_i, [[count]] _arr - _i]);
	_res
};

// Example
arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [1,2,3,4];
[arr, ["a","b"], 2] [[call]] KK_fnc_insert; //[1,2,"a","b",3,4]</code>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 21, 2015 - 15:52 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
A faster alternative to [[BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack]] using [[append]]:
<code>KK_fnc_pushStack <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> {
	_this [[select]] 0 [[append]] (_this [[select]] 1);
	_this [[select]] 0
};

// Example
arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [1,2,3];
[arr,[4,5,6]] [[call]] KK_fnc_pushStack; //both arr and function return are [1,2,3,4,5,6]</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
